title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Kaynes Tech falls as lapses flagged; company denies errors
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Kaynes Technology's shares slid ~**6.7%** after brokerages flagged lapses in disclosures and a Kotak **Equities** report raised concerns (five‑day drop ~**22.8%**).
- The company says there was only one accounting error and that other notes on related‑party transactions were a *small typographical omission*, with **no ambiguities** in the books.
- FY25 revenue rose to ₹2,720 crore (+51% YoY) aided by *Iskraemeco*'s smart metering consolidation and acquisitions, with **Ind‑AS 103** treatment and corresponding goodwill/asset adjustments.

Tamil Nadu targets global market with new Toy Manufacturing Policy 2025
Indian startups entering global markets to shield operational tech from cyberthreats
Call of duty infuses fresh energy into local gear makers
India emerges as key driver of global renewable energy surge: Joshi
Ritu Raj Sinha passes away; Tata Steel UISL MD
items.author: B Sridhar
items.summary:
- *Ritu Raj Sinha*, 58, MD of Tata Steel UISL and former Tata Steel corporate administrator, passed away after suffering a nose bleed following lunch.
- The city mourned **TS UISL**'s work, which boosted public amenities and helped **Jamshedpur** rank 3rd in **Swachh Survekshan 2024-25**.
- Last rites will be held at Parvati Ghat crematorium on November 9; tributes came from former Odisha governor **Raghubar Das** and other leaders.

items.title: India says no advisory to stop clean energy funding
items.summary:
- *India's clean energy ministry said it has not issued any advisory to pause or halt new financing for the solar sector.*
- *The clarification followed Reuters' report that lenders were advised to adopt a calibrated approach due to oversupply, not to stop funding.*
- *Analysts warned that broad caution could hurt solar cell manufacturing and delay projects, increasing reliance on imports.*

items.title: Defence production hits ₹1.51 lakh cr; exports near ₹24k cr
items.summary:
- *Rajnath Singh* said India is shifting from import-dependence to a producer-exporter as defence production rose to ₹1.51 lakh crore and exports near ₹24,000 crore.
- BRO (Border Roads Organisation) completed 28 roads and 93 bridges across Ladakh, J&K and seven states at ₹5,000 crore.
- The push under *Aatmanirbhar Bharat* and indigenous tech shows engineering self-reliance, including Class-70 modular bridges designed and manufactured in India.

items.title: Smart-meter interoperability; 307 GW coal by 2035
items.summary:
- *Interoperability* across smart meters to avoid vendor lock-in, with different manufacturers on common protocols; rollout targeted for **April 2026** or **January 2027**.
- India aims to keep **307 GW** coal capacity by 2035, with transmission upgrades like Khetri-Narela (>4.5 GW) and Badla-Seekar to ease bottlenecks.
- RDSS has sanctioned **20.33 crore** smart meters in 28 states/UTs, of which **2.41 crore** installed; Gujarat sanctioned **1.67 crore**, with **20.94 lakh** installed; scheme reduces AT&C losses and improves reliability.

items.title: Copper industry seeks curb on cheap imports
items.author: Nikita Periwal, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Indian copper producers, led by the *IPCPA*, urge the government to curb cheap imports from FTAs, including *ASEAN* and *Japan*. 
- They seek an **additional 3%** duty on copper cathodes, rods, wires and tubes, plus quantitative import curbs, citing about *₹20,000 crore* invested in the last five years. 
- The report highlights tariff rules under CEPA with the UAE (wire-rods duties falling to zero by FY27 and a call for a ~1/3 cut in the tariff quota) and notes Indonesia’s continued refined copper shipments under ASEAN despite concentrate bans.

items.title: Not issued any advisory to stop finance to renewables: MNRE
items.summary:
- The **MNRE** clarified it has not issued any advisory to *financial institutions* to stop lending to renewable energy projects or to renewable energy equipment manufacturing facilities.
- It said it has circulated the status of domestic *solar PV manufacturing* to lenders to enable a calibrated financing approach, not to halt funding.
- The ministry will continue engaging with stakeholders to keep India's solar journey *inclusive*, *competitive*, and *future-ready*, supported by the PLI scheme and ALMM.

items.title: EAM talks deeper cooperation at India-Japan Forum
items.summary: - **EAM S Jaishankar** participated in the India-Japan Forum opening session in New Delhi, discussing the evolving world order and deeper *India-Japan cooperation*.\n- The forum aims to bolster cooperation, build mutual trust, and develop a joint agenda for future cooperation, with 70–80 high-level participants under Chatham House rules.\n- Earlier remarks in 2024 highlighted strengthening ties in *semiconductor collaboration*, defence and resilient supply chains, underscoring the growing strategic partnership.

items.title: Coking coal imports rise in Oct on winter restocking
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Coking coal imports rose 12% to *5.04 MT*, aided by *winter restocking* by steel mills, while **overall coal imports** fell 3.9% to 20.97 MT.
- The decline in imports reflects a domestic surplus; steel manufacturers usually boost purchases before colder months to secure supplies.
- Initiatives like the **Coking Coal Mission** and the *WDO route* aim to raise domestic coking coal use and curb imports, with Q4 imports likely subdued as domestic production rises.

items.title: Manomay expands capacity, adopts cleaner production
items.summary:
- Rajasthan-based Manomay Tex India Ltd is expanding capacity with 864 spindles and pursuing *cleaner production* for sustainable growth.
- It is strengthening its domestic and international footprint, exporting to 16+ countries including Colombia, Mexico, Egypt, Chile, and Venezuela.
- In H1 FY26, revenue reached ₹330 crore and PAT ₹10 crore, aided by measures like zero liquid discharge, water recycling, and renewable energy.

items.title: The solar surge and the supply chain gap: India’s energy triumph and industrial paradox
SFO Tech mulling ₹2,270 crore electronic components plant in Tamil Nadu
Piyush Goyal holds key meetings to strengthen ties in semiconductors, carbon capture and medtech
Mobile phone imports drop to 0.02% of demand in 2024-25
items.author: Press Trust of India
items.summary: - Mobile phone imports have fallen to *0.02%* of domestic demand in 2024-25, down from *75%* in *2014-15*.\n- Mobile phone exports surged to ₹2 lakh crore in 2024-25, up *127x* from ₹0.01 lakh crore in *2014-15*.\n- The government’s measures, including *PLI schemes* and *Atma Nirbhar Bharat*, aim to boost domestic electronics manufacturing.

items.title: Cabinet push to healthcare manufacturing, life science hub
items.summary: - The Bhubaneswar cabinet approved the Odisha Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Policy-2025 to position Odisha as a hub for *healthcare manufacturing* and *life science sectors*.\n- It envisages the Odisha Pharma Park and Odisha Medtech Park to provide industrial infrastructure, with the **Odisha Pharmaceutical Development Cell** as the lead agency.\n- The policy maps a strategic route and cluster formation to realize a prosperous Odisha by 2036 and a developed India by 2047.
